basics.name: Jakub Liska
basics.label: Programmer
basics.summary: Recovered overengineer, pragmatically oriented with a passion for open source, searching for and learning technologies that allow me to be more productive and excited about at the same time. Currently I focus on client side development using Scala and Scala.js but I have a long history of developing backend Java/Scala applications

work.summary: A tool for writing and managing markdown documents - becoming collaboration/specification/documentation app for PM
highlights: scala.js, Monifu, ScalaTags, uPickle, uTest, bootstrap

work.summary: Postfix Mass Mail log processing tool, mining reasons of bounced messages for newsletter analytics
DBMS for IndexedDB engine, based on Rx principles (type safety, resilience, backpressure, user friendly (reduces all Idb CRUD features to 4 API methods)
Gremlin-Server client with ad-hoc extensible, reactive, typeclass based API allowing for using turing complete graph traversal language gremlin to query graph databases from browser
Very light websocket server and browser client based on Rx principles
highlights: scala.js, scala, java-websocket, Monifu, uPickle, uTest

work.summary: Improves keyboard event handling experience in hostile browser environment and allows for avoiding onpress events that are cross-browser incompatible and soon to be deprecated
One of the core developers of a corporate intranet portal and web Content Management System Edee. Mass Mailing system development was my secondary specialization.
highlights: Java & Scala, Spring, Akka, Mysql, MapDB, ...

work.summary: Joins demand (people, companies) with supply (professional translators) (hibernated at the expense of buying an apartment, never finished)
Software integration of Schengen Information System with Czech Ministry of the interior
